console.audit-file.description: audit log file to save commands and results

console.prompt.description: prompt used in REPL. prompt components are: '%t': current time as timestamp, '%p': duration of last command in seconds, '%d': name of current database, '%e': current endpoint, '%E': current endpoint without protocol, '%u': current user

define.description: define key=value for a @key@ entry in config file

dump-options.description: dump configuration options in JSON format

javascript.check-syntax.description: syntax check code Javascript code from file

javascript.current-module-directory.description: add current directory to module path

javascript.gc-interval.description: request-based garbage collection interval (each n.th commands)

javascript.startup-directory.description: startup paths containing the Javascript files

javascript.unit-tests.description: do not start as shell, run unit tests instead

jslint.description: do not start as shell, run jslint instead

log.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.force-direct.description: do not start a seperate thread for logging

log.foreground-tty.description: also log to tty if backgrounded

log.keep-logrotate.description: keep the old log file after receiving a sighup

log.level.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.line-number.description: append line number and file name

log.prefix.description: prefix log message with this string

log.shorten-filenames.description: shorten filenames in log output (use with --log.line-number)

log.thread.description: show thread identifier in log message

log.thread-name.description: show thread name in log message

log.use-local-time.description: use local timezone instead of UTC

random.generator.description: random number generator to use (1 = MERSENNE, 2 = RANDOM, 3 = URANDOM, 4 = COMBINED (not for Windows), 5 = WinCrypt (Windows only)

server.ask-jwt-secret.description: if this option is specified, the user will be prompted for a JWT secret. This option is not compatible with --server.username or --server.password. If specified, it will be used for all connections - even when a new connection to another server is created

server.authentication.description: require authentication credentials when connecting (does not affect the server-side authentication settings)

server.database.description: database name to use when connecting

server.endpoint.description: endpoint to connect to, use 'none' to start without a server

server.max-packet-size.description: maximum packet size (in bytes) for client/server communication

server.password.description: password to use when connecting. If not specified and authentication is required, the user will be prompted for a password

ssl.protocol.description: ssl protocol (1 = SSLv2, 2 = SSLv2 or SSLv3 (negotiated), 3 = SSLv3, 4 = TLSv1, 5 = TLSV1.2)
